name: server/constants/Constants.js
ProtocolVersion
description: The Lucid Protocol version that the server and client are running.

name: ServerStatus
description: Describes the state of the Server.

properties.name: AVAILABLE
properties.description: Shows that the server is ready/available.

properties.name: UNAVAILABLE
properties.description: Shows that the server is unavailable and is not attempting to start/restart.

properties.name: RESTARTING
properties.description: Shows that the server is unavailable but is trying to restart.

properties.name: STARTING
properties.description: Shows that the server is starting up for the first time.

name: ClientStatus
description: Describes the state of a Client.

properties.name: ACTIVE
properties.description: Shows that the Client is active - it is connected.

properties.name: INACTIVE
properties.description:
Shows that the Client is inactive - it is disconnected, but has the chance
to renew its session. Clients may be inactive when their connection has dropped.

properties.name: REMOVED
properties.description:
Shows that the Client is disconnected and they are not permitted to return to their
session.

properties.name: UNAUTHORIZED
properties.description: Shows that the Client is unauthorized. Only applies to UnknownClient.

name: ServerDefaultOptions
description: Default options for a Server's setup.

name: PacketTypes
description: Object containing Packet Types

name: DisconnectTypes
description: Object containing Disconnect Packet Types

name: Errors
description: Object containing Error Types

name: server/constants/errors/Errors.js
INVALID_MESSAGE_FROM_CLIENT
description: Thrown when the client send an incorrect message i.e. bad compression or bad json

name: Errors
description: Object containing custom errors

name: server/constants/packets/Packets.js
CLIENT_NEW_SESSION_REQUEST
description: Describes a Client requesting a new session.

name: CLIENT_EXISTING_SESSION_REQUEST
description: Describes a Client requesting to return to an existing session.

name: SERVER_DISCONNECTING_CLIENT
description: Describes when the server is going to disconnect a client.

name: SERVER_ACCEPT_SESSION_REQUEST
description: Describes when a Server accepts a new/existing session request.

name: SERVER_AT_MAXIMUM_CAPACITY
description: DisconnectType - Describes when the Server is disconnecting/refusing the client as it is running at maximum capacity.

name: TOOK_TOO_LONG_TO_AUTH
description:
DisconnectType - Describes when a Client opens a connection to the server, but takes too long to send an
authentication packet.

name: server/index.js
server/server/ExpressServer.js
ExpressServerOptions
description: Object containing options for ExpressServer

name: LucidExpressServer
description: The LucidExpressServer handles HTTP REST requests for the Lucid Server, e.g. server metadata.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new ExpressServer. Developers shouldn't instantiate this class themselves, it is done by LucidServer.

params.name: lucidServer
params.description: The Lucid Server that the ExpressServer is serving under.

name: lucidServer
description: Lucid Server that the ExpressServer is serving under.

name: options
description: Options for the ExpressServer, obtained from the owning Server's options.

name: app
description: The express application that the server is using.

name: metaRouter
description: Express Router for managing core Lucid requests.

name: customRouter
description: Express Router for managing custom requests.

name: httpServer
description: The HTTP server the express application is running on.

name: attach
description: Attaches a HTTP server to the Express Server

name: server/server/Server.js
ServerOptions
description: Object containing the options for the Server

properties.name: express
properties.description: Options for the Express (REST API) Server.

properties.name: mount
properties.description: Path to mount the LucidServer on, defaults to `/` (root)

properties.name: maxClients
properties.description: Maximum amount of clients the server should handle

name: LucidServer
description: Manages the Express (HTTP), WebSocket Server and connections

name: constructor
description: Creates a new LucidServer class.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the object.

name: options
description: The options passed to the Server upon instantiation.

name: status
description: The status of the server

name: express
description: The Express Server of the Client

name: wss
description: The WebSocket Server of the Client

name: attach
description: Attaches a HTTP Server to the Express and WebSocket Servers, essentially starting up the LucidServer.

name: server/server/WebSocketServer.js
WebSocketServerOptions
description: Object containing options for LucidWebSocketServer

properties.name: hearbeat
properties.description:
Interval of heartbeats in milliseconds. Set to -1 to disable heartbeats.
Heartbeats are used to verify whether connections are active.

properties.name: allowedAuthTime
properties.description:
Maximum time in milliseconds that a client has to request authentication
before it is disconnected.

name: LucidWebSocketServer
description: The WebSocketServer handles WebSocket connections and sessions

name: constructor
description: Creates a new WebSocketServer. Developers shouldn't instantiate this class themselves, it is done by LucidServer.

params.name: lucidServer
params.description: The LucidServer that the WebSocketServer is running under.

name: lucidServer
description: Lucid Server that the ExpressServer is serving under.

name: options
description: Options for the WebSocketServer, obtained from the owning Server's options.

name: wss
description: The WebSocket Server that the LucidWebSocketServer class wraps around.

name: connections
description: An Array of Authorized Clients.

name: attach
description: Attaches a HTTP Server, essentially starting the WebSocket Server.

name: canAllowNewConnections
description: Describes whether the server has the capacity to take any new connections.

return.description: Returns true if there is capacity for a new connection.

name: attachHandlers
description: Attach WSS Handlers

name: EventConnection
description: Handles WebSocketServer 'connection' events

name: EventError
description: Handles WebSocketServer 'error' events

name: EventHeaders
description: Handles WebSocketServer 'headers' events

name: AuthorizeNewSession
description: Authorizes a previously "unknown" client with a new session.

name: server/structures/AuthorizedClient.js
AuthorizedClient
description: Represents a WebSocket Client that has authorised/authorized themselves.

name: constructor
description:
Creates a new AuthorizedClient. Developers shouldn't instantiate AuthorizedClients,
the WebSocketServer does it automatically.

params.name: wss
params.description: the WSS the Client is connected to.

params.name: token
params.description: The private token of the Client

name: status
description:
ACTIVE by default because when an AuthorizedClient is first created, it means a WebSocket connection
is active

name: uuid
description: The UUID of the Client

name: token
description: The private token of the Client

name: server/structures/Client.js
Client
description: Represents a WebSocket Client.

name: constructor
description:
Creates a new Client. Developers shouldn't instantiate Client,
the WebSocketServer does it automatically.

params.name: wss
params.description: the WSS the Client is connected to.

name: wss
description: The LucidWebSocketServer that the Client is connected to.

name: socket
description: The WebSocket connection of the Client.

name: authorized
description: Represents whether the Client is authorized or not.

name: intervals
description: An Array of Intervals. They are stored so they can be cleared if required.

name: timeouts
description: An Array of Timeouts. They are stored so they can be cleared if required.

name: status
description: The status of the Client.

name: attachHandlers
description: Attaches event handlers to the WebSocket

name: detachHandlers
description: Removes all message, close and error event listeners.

name: PreEventMessage
description: Handles the WebSocket 'message' event and normalizes data

name: EventMessage
description: Handles normalized data from 'PreEventMessage'

name: EventClose
description: Handles the WebSocket 'close' event

name: EventError
description: Handles the WebSocket 'error' event

name: send
description: Sends a custom packet to the Client

name: sendInternal
description: Sends an unmodified packet to the Client

name: killConnection
description: Kills connection to the client

params.name: returnAllowed
params.description:
States whether the Client is allowed to return to their session
after being disconnected.

params.name: extra
params.description: Extra information about the disconnect, useful for custom disconnect reasons.

name: cleanWebSocket
description: Terminates the WebSocket and cleans all WebSocket related information, but doesn't end the session.

name: removeReferences
description: Removes references to the Client internally

name: server/structures/UnknownClient.js
UnknownClient
description: Represents a WebSocket Client that has connected, but has not authorised/authorized yet.

name: constructor
description:
Creates a new UnknownClient. Developers shouldn't instantiate UnknownClient,
the WebSocketServer does it automatically.

params.name: wss
params.description: the WSS the Client is connected to.

name: checkAuth
description: Checks whether or not the Client has been authenticated. If it hasn't, it is disconnected.

name: EventMessage
description: Handles packet events

name: breakDown
description: Breaks down the unknown client, removing listeners.

name: server/test/test.js
server/util/Util.js
Options
description: Merge a nested default options object with a custom object.

params.name: custom
params.description: custom object to fill in missing properties with values from the default object.
